page.title: 01Crathie and Balmoral
page.content: This area is one of great natural beauty. There are hills, forests and moorland. Plants and wild life are found in great numbers and varieties. The people find work on farms, estates or in Lochnagar Distillery. Their homes are scattered and there is no village as such. There is a two teacher primary school, a post office and a shop and Crathie Kirk which is attended by the local people as well as the Royal Family. Social activities in the area include badminton, golf, cricket, curling, clay pigeon shooting and various women's groups. During the summer the area is very popular as a tourist centre. In the winter when the weather can be most severe, the more outlying farms and homesteads are often cut off by heavy snowfalls.
